sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使人不安或烦恼"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bother, disturb, trouble, annoy, irritate, vex
means: bother ： 指使人烦恼而引起的紧张不安或感到不耐烦。
disturb ： 较正式用词，多用被动态。指拢乱，使人不能平静或妨碍别人工作、思维或正常秩序，是程度较深的烦恼。
trouble ： 指给人在行动上带来不便或在身心上造成痛苦。
annoy ： 强调因被迫忍受令人不快、讨厌的事而失去平静或耐心，多指一时的打拢或恼怒。
irritate ： 语气比annoy强得多，指激怒，使发怒，多指一种短时间的反应。
vex ： 侧重指因不断的干扰而引起的烦恼，有时含激怒的意味。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"激怒"之意。
means: provoke ： 指激起某人强烈的愤怒，以致令人作出反应。
irritate ： 通常指因受到不愉快的刺激而失去耐性，变得烦燥或恼怒。
aggravate ： 口语用词。指因长时间的反复言行而引起不快、烦躁或恼怒。

sentence.Network_en: Wear rubber gloves while chopping chillies as they can irritate the skin.
sentence.Network_cn: 切辣椒时要戴橡胶手套，因为辣椒会刺激皮肤。

sentence.Network_en: Her uncritical acceptance of everything I said began to irritate me.
sentence.Network_cn: 我说什么她都不论对错一概接受，这倒惹我不耐烦起来。

sentence.Network_en: Don't irritate her, she's on a short fuse today.
sentence.Network_cn: 别惹她, 她今天动不动就发火.

derivation.yuyuan_name: 16th cent. (in the sense 'excite, provoke'): from Latin irritat- 'irritated', from the verb irritare

entry.def: If something irritates you, it keeps annoying you.

example.ex: Perhaps they were irritated by the sound of crying.
example.tran: 也许他们被哭声惹烦了。

entry.tran: 刺激(身体部位);使发痒;使疼痛
entry.def: If something irritates a part of your body, it causes it to itch or become sore.

example.ex: Wear rubber gloves while chopping chillies as they can irritate the skin.
example.tran: 切辣椒时要戴橡胶手套,因为辣椒会刺激皮肤。

means.word_mean: 1. cause annoyance in; disturb, especially by minor irritations;

sentences.sentence: "Mosquitoes buzzing in my ear really bothers me"
"It irritates me that she never closes the door after she leaves"

means.word_mean: 2. excite to an abnormal condition, of chafe or inflame;
3. excite to some characteristic action or condition, such as motion, contraction, or nervous impulse, by the application of a stimulus;

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"使……,成为,进入,再"; 2. 放在同辅音词根前表示"不,无"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不顾的, 不考虑的, 无关的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ir不,无+respective各自的→adj.不顾的, 不考虑的, 无关的
ir不,无+reproachable能被指责的→adj.无可指责的
ir不,无+resistible可抗拒的→adj.不可抗拒的
ir不,无+resolute果断的→adj.无决断力的
ir不,无+refutable可反驳的→adj.无可反驳的
ir不,无+revocable可取消的→adj.不可取消的
ir使……,成为,进入,再+rupt断+ion表名词→打断[别人]→闯入
ir不+regularity整齐, 匀称→n.不规则,无规律
ir使……,成为,进入,再+rig水+ate表动词→进水→灌溉
ir使……,成为,进入,再+rit擦+ate表动词→进入磨擦→激怒
ir使……,成为,进入,再+radi光线+ate表动词→发光→生辉

Sentence.sentence: He is irritated at having to wait for Jane.

They practically beg a user to ignore the long-suffering professor struggling to pass on accumulated wisdom from the front of the room - a prospect that teachers find most irritating and students view as, well, inevitable.
It can forge better relationships and help you cope with life, or it can be corrosive eating away your self-esteem and irritating others.
I had an old aunt who used to throw cups of tea at people when she was particularly irritated.

means.word_mean: 使感到不适, 使疼痛

sentences.cn: 粗糙的料子会使皮肤难受。

jushi.english: It irritates and I want to scratch.
jushi.chinese: 那地方总觉得痒痒，我想挠一挠。

jushi.english: It irritated me to learn that she had been promoted.
jushi.chinese: 听说她提升了，我很生气。
烟熏得她的眼睛很难受。
